data.question: I am light as a feather yet no man can hold me for long. What am I?
I am emeralds and diamonds, lost by the moon. I am found by the sun and picked up soon. What am I
What can run but never walks, has a mouth but never talks, has a bed but never sleeps, has a head but never weeps?
Feed me and I live. Give me drink and I die. What am I?
I occur once in a minute, twice in every moment, but not once in a hundred thousands years. What am I?
Man walks over; man walks under; in time of war he burns asunder?
This thing runs but cannot walk, sometimes sings but never talks. Lacks arms, has hands; lacks a head but has a face. What is it?
I have a hundred legs but cannot stand, a long neck but no head; I eat the maids life. What am I??
In a tunnel of darkness lies a beast of iron. It can only attack when pulled back. What is it?
If you break me, I'll not stop working. If you can touch me, my work is done. If you lose me, you must find me with a ring soon after. What am I?
Cannot be seen, cannot be felt, cannot be heard, cannot be smelt. It lies behind the stars and beneath the hills. Ends life and kills laughter. What is it?
What builds up castles, tears down mountains, makes some blind, helps others to see?
What lives in water, dies in summer, and grows with its root upwards?
With no wings, I fly. With no eyes, I see. With no arms, I climb. More frightening than any beast, stronger than any foe. I am cunning, ruthless, and tall; in the end I rule all. What am I?
